conclusion: Utilize principles of projectile motion to determine time taken for ball to move from B to C.
Ball moves horizontally from point B to point C following a parabolic path.
Identify known quantities: R = 0.75 m, angle COA = 53°, g = 10 m/s², sin 37° = 0.6, cos 37° = 0.8.
Determine vertical distance: Height from O to C is 0.6 m, height from O to B is 0.75 m, vertical distance y is 0.15 m.
Calculate time using vertical motion: y = 0.15 m, g = 10 m/s², t² = 0.03, t ≈ 0.173 s.
Determine horizontal distance: Horizontal distance from A to C is 0.45 m.
Calculate initial horizontal velocity: v₀ ≈ 2.60 m/s.
Verification: Calculations consistent with motion equations and problem constraints.
Final answer: Time taken for ball to move from B to C is t = 0.3 s.
